column1: Yehud (Hebrew: יְהוּד‎) is a city in the Central District in Israel that is part of the joint municipality of Yehud-Monosson. In 2007
Parts of Yehud are located on the land of the Palestinian village of al-'Abbasiyya
column2: which became depopulated in the  1948 Arab–Israeli War.In June 2011
column3: the city's officials announced they would undertake a massive construction project to replicate the old town square of the Swiss city of Lugano in the center of their city
column4: to reinvigorate commerce and tourism. The replica will be replete with neoclassical columns and colonnades. This project was scheduled to be finished and in fall 2016. It opened in early 2018

column2: the Yehud-Monosson Municipality was formed to provide municipal services to Yehud and the neighboring community of Neve Monosson (pop. 2
column3: 600). Under the terms of the merger
column4: Neve Monosson remains with a high level of autonomy under the Neve Monosson Local Administration (minhelet). The Neve Monosson Local Administration was granted municipal status as an autonomous borough (vaad rova ironi) by the Interior Minister in 2005 within the implementation of the merger plan. In a practical sense
column5: the Yehud-Monosson Municipality really functions as the municipality of Yehud whilst providing basic statutory municipal services to Neve Monosson on an outsourcing basis.

column2: in 2001 the ethnic makeup of the city was all Jewish. See Population groups in Israel. According to CBS

column1: Yehud serves as the base of the large Africa Israel Investments company majority owned by Lev Leviev.The control room of SpaceIL is in Yehud. From that base
column2: SpaceIL manages the operations of the Beresheet lander.

column3: 159 students in the city. They are spread out
column7: 907 high school students. 54.2% of 12th grade students were entitled to a matriculation certificate in 2001.

column1: Football: (Soccer) Hapoel Yehud spent several seasons in the top division of Israeli football during the late 1970s and early 1980s
column2: and won the State Cup in 1982. However
column3: after several relegations the club folded in 1998. A new club
column5: was established in 2004 and currently plays in Liga Gimel. (Division III)
